website_summaries.verdict: A very good compact camera, the 10-megapixel Canon PowerShot SD900 nonetheless falls short of its faster, more full-featured, albeit lower-resolution competitors.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my father-i-law
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father in law as he wanted to get into digitial photography but didn't want anything large or complicated. I think Canon has some of the best lenses and imaging software so I I decided to give him this one. It didn't disappoint. A novice can take it out of the box and take a nice photo with it. the controls are laid out well and the photos are clear and noise free.
customer_reviews.author: James Caron

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camera!!! I used it along with a GoPRo and it has never failed me. This is my second Powershot...the other one did not survive being submerged in sea water...go figure, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Coolage

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is wonderful! The clarity of the pictures is amazing , it's very durable I can't tell you how many times I've dropped it . It's very easy to use .
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Third Canon product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon camera. I have a antique Optura PI video DV camera that serves well to this day for video, of course. I purchased a Canon Powershot S400 that I am very happy with, unfortuneately it now throws a memory card error. I could have it serviced but I figured it was time to upgrade it. The new Canon SD 900 is so much faster, less time on start up and auto focus. The larger screen is nice too but getting a grip on this camera is a bit odd as suggested by other reviewers. Physically the same size and weight of the old one, just more refined controls.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Szymanski

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of digital cameras before this one, and both were plastic, and fairly delicate. I don't know if it's the titanium, or just the internal construction, but this is a tough camera. I dropped it onto a parking lot from waist level (ahh!), and picked it up with no problems. I also dropped it from about 12 feet (in a case) onto a grass field, and that didn't cause any problems either. Some of these other reviews have complained about image blurriness and clarity, but taking pictures of anything that is moving is difficult, with any camera. I think this camera works great, and was definitely worth the money. The battery lasts a long time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes Great Pictures
customer_reviews.text: I really do love Canon Power Shot! I bought this one and didn't have any problem using it. It takes great picture!
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: My third Canon PowerShot - I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's small, sturdy and takes phenomenal pictures. I use the macros and change the ISO settings quite a bit, so I haven't had many blurry pictures (nighttime ones without flash). The display in the back is HUGE. A bit heavier than other cameras this size, but I feel it's sturdier. The size is excellent. Small enough to fit into a clutch.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kohatsu

customer_reviews.title: Junk, "Lens Error Problem is common, no fix, camera junked after this..."
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with this camera, used it for 2 years, then out of the blue, the lens would not retract and a message of "lens error, please restart camera" comes up, changing batteries did not fix it, nothing did. Looked on the Internet and found this is a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zozobra

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small digital camera. I take it everywhere and it takes wonderful pictures. I wanted something small to just slide in my purse or my pocket instead of carrying my big Canon digital rebel around, and the SD900 is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Funkhouser

customer_reviews.title: not a sgood as the price
customer_reviews.text: I am not ahppy with the colors and picture stabilization. did expected lot more when you pay 350 for point to shoot camera. horrible dark shots and very blure. picture stabilization is worst than my cell phone camera some time
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice small camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good buy! Nice small camera, good definition, lots and lots of options. Would recommend it for people that like to take nice photos without having to think much about it as the "auto" options seems infinite. But also a good camera for someone a bit more interested into photography (but not that much!) The only negative thing, seems to be the lack of battery indicator... but the battery seems to last forever! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Marta Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Camera in a league of its own...
customer_reviews.text: 10MP, great control set, diminuitive size. Maybe a bit too small for some things, but high quality titanium case and more features than most amateur photographers need. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: George Z. Marootian

customer_reviews.title: What a camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera!!! I only wished that I had waited a few more weeks until the 12 MP camera came out. Oh well, technology changes too fast and only millionaires can stay trendy.
customer_reviews.author: ldav70

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent
customer_reviews.text: Impressive, tons of compliments, this beauty is magnificent, Bought as gift for my son who lives in Miami Beach,FL. He was loving all functions And the 10 megapix is fantastic,with titanium body, love it...
customer_reviews.author: Martha Wright

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Elf for my wife and it's the best one yet. We bought it to shoot new born Grandchildren. Using the center weighted exposure works really well creating good skin tones and letting white sheets do as they will.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: thanks so much!
customer_reviews.text: the camera is exactly the same as the one I dipped in the lake...oops! It works with the model-specific water case that I should have used to avoid this predicament! The camera was in great used condition, exactly as specified, complete with manuals, charger and extra battery, as well as a 2 mg card. Thanks so much for the speedy and quality service!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Di

customer_reviews.title: Cannon is a good brand camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with the picture quality and the durability of the camera. I wish it was a little bit thinner. Picture quality is great, so far I've found it the best among other similar features cameras. Cannon is know for its picture entertainment industry. Cameras is what they know best!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Tarhini

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my wife for Christmas. I use it more then she does, it is great. I have a Canon SLR D30 that was almost three thousand dollars and the SD9000 takes as good or better pictures then the expensive Canon. Although you can't change lenses on this camera it is still a great camera for everyday use and I have no problem recommending it to anyone. Five is not enough stars for this camera. Gordon
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Traskos

customer_reviews.title: A simple, yet capable shirt  pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a lot of capability with 10 mega pixerls. The colors are true, I like the sensitivity in low light better than my Canon Rebel 8 mega pixel camera. It is not a camera with changable lens features, but for its size and price I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lavell R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Packed full of options
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easy to read instruction manual, great pictures, and if you are shaking when taking a picture the camera will tell you, which is very helpfull.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful Monster

customer_reviews.title: newcam
customer_reviews.text: This little beauty outshoots my slr and its nikon lenses. Coupled with a 2 gig card it is a wonderful tool for my photo excursions...light and compact (fits my pocket even with the case on it).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SD 900
customer_reviews.text: Great features -- especially ISO 3200. Takes very good pictures. Easy Macro setting. I like the special features, night, beach, folage settings are excellent. I don't understand the aquariium setting -- but hey I not a fishy person. I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Schaeufele

customer_reviews.title: Little Wonder
customer_reviews.text: This camera is Great!! Its just the perfect size, and I love the fact that they enlarged the view screen in the back. the previous elphs had more hardware, less viewer screen. Its also user friendly, becsuse most folks hate to read complicated manuals.
customer_reviews.author: f.george

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with our new camera.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little machine with so many settings, it will take me a while to learn them all.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Leica D-LUX 3 on March. It broke right away. After I sent the junk back to Leica, I bought the Canon SD900 right away. This is the best camera I have ever had. My first Canon SD 900 was stolen by someone while I was on my business trip. I bought another same model on the same day while I came back home. Leica finally fixed the D LUX 3 for me. I through it away. Canon SD 900 is the best.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. LIU

customer_reviews.title: A great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a camera which takes excellent pictures. It has an eye to look through as well as the screen. This metal frame makes it a very strong camera.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Beckling Jr

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD900 Titanium 10MP Digital Elph Camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes great pictures. Two items to consider - there is no indication for remaining battery charge (versus Sony 7.2 MP CyberShot which gives specific minutes remaining) nor a low battery indicator. It just shuts off. It also is extremely sensitive to movement of fingers past the function dial. Just holding the camera anywhere near the dial causes one of the menus to pop up. This can occur frequently when holding or turning the camera to capture the best angle.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Happy

customer_reviews.title: Good But Imperfect
customer_reviews.text: The camera is beautiful, and very sturdy. Going on looks, you won't be disappointed. It also takes wonderful pictures, in perfect conditions. I finally gave up and sold this camera, to replace it with a 950is. I highly recommend opting for a camera with IS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rojek

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD900 Titanium 10MP
customer_reviews.text: I love my Canon. Two of my friends bought one also and we are all very happy with it. I tried the Sony, Casio and other brands and decided to go with Canon. Very happy with my choice!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Majano

customer_reviews.title: Find an alternative to ZoomBrowser
customer_reviews.text: This is my second digital Canon camera, the first is a G3. Both are great! The problem is that the supplied software, ZoomBrowser, has serious problems, at least on Windows XP Professional. After installing the software for the SD900 under one userID, ZoomBrowser will not run under any other userID. The problem appears as a "Critical Error" "Invalid class string". A google search indicates that this is not an uncommon problem, and Canon is pretty unresponsive in providing a solution. After a couple of email exchanges with Canon, I'm not optimistic that they have capable user support -- at least for software.
customer_reviews.author: Canon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Cliff's review
customer_reviews.text: I found this product to be as ordered. It has performed well though I have not had a chance to try all of its features.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: bat seller
customer_reviews.text: This product you sold me does not correspond to the images the camera is in poor condition. The LCD has a great scratches and imperfections, not explained in the product description. pictures of the accessories, which are not where's the charger, cd, usb cable and video. Not specified, this included, for putting those photos that do not match the real image camera functions. Terrible seller, if it is used to explain the real state of the camera, put product description as new. and I want my money back that your camera already is back.
customer_reviews.author: L-----O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent because has a eyepiece viewer so you can see ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent because has a eyepiece viewer so you can see to shoot in sunlight. This is 2nd one I own because they quit making them.
customer_reviews.author: Quay

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD900 Titanium 10MP Digital Elph Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Style:SD900The PowerShot SD900 features a 10-million-pixel CCD sensor. This high-resolution imager ensures every picture will have excellent detail, even when printed large or cropped.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The PowerShot SD900 features a 10-million-pixel CCD sensor. This high-resolution imager ensures every picture will have excellent detail, even when printed large or cropped. 

DIGIC III Image Processor
The brand new DIGIC III Imaging Processor developed exclusively by Canon plays an integral role in producing superior images, it speeds up in-camera operations, and improves image quality and functionality. It also maximizes battery consumption for solid performance. 

Face Detection
The use of the new DIGIC III processor includes the new face priority function for detecting human faces in a scene for both autofocus and autoexposure. This optimizes both focus and exposure of an image for your subject's face. 

High ISO Sensitivity
ISO range up to ISO 1600 for less blur in low light while hand-holding. With the Image Stabilized lens, and exclusive DIGIC II Image Processor, images shot at higher ISO speeds are sharp, and noise is minimal.

 2.5-Inch High-Resolution LCD Monitor
Enjoy composing and reviewing images with the big 2.5-inch LCD monitor. With this size LCD screen with 230,000 pixels (twice the resolution of its predecessor), it is quite easy to navigate through the menu and utilize the direct printing features as well. 

Enhanced Digital Zoom
The SD900 features two new ways to maximize digital zoom performance: Safety Zoom and Digital Teleconverter. With Safety Zoom enabled the lens will go beyond its optical limit while maintaining acceptable image quality; with lower resolutions additional digital zoom becomes available. The Digital Teleconverter emulates the use of a 1.4x and 2.3x teleconversion lens with impressive image quality. 

3x Optical Zoom
As found in previous Digital Elph cameras, the SD900 utilizes a 3x optical zoom lens. This zoom range has proven to be a perfect combination of compact size and incredible usability (35mm equivalent: 37-111). Along with its great zoom range, the SD900's lens is equipped with two aspherical lens elements to ensure high image quality. 

Waterproof Case
Expand creative photo opportunities with the waterproof case WP-DC7. Take up to 130 feet underwater and still utilize all of the controls the camera has to offer. (This case is not included. It must be purchased separately.)
feature_bullets: 10-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 18 x 24-inch prints
Sleek titanium body and perpetual curve design; touch-control dial for increased usability
Stores images on SD cards; powered by Lithium-ion rechargeable battery NB-5L
ISO now ranges from 80-1600; now supports SDHC cards (Secure Digital cards with over 2 GB capacity)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars142 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
